thread.title: Athlete of the Week Riley Russell--NORTH PAULDING
thread.title_full: Athlete of the Week Riley Russell--NORTH PAULDING

author: Neighbor Newspapers (noreply@neighbornewspapers.com)
title: Athlete of the Week Riley Russell--NORTH PAULDING
text: slideshow North Paulding senior Riley Russell spent a lot of time on base this season and that fact has set her up for a softball career at Florida SouthWestern State College next year.While helping the Lady Wolfpack to a 17-8 record and 9-3 Region 4- mark, Russell earned a batting average of .311 and an on-base percentage of .576 with 37 walks against just seven strikeouts.“I’m trying to get on base the best way possible whether earning a walk, getting a hit or beating out a slapper,” said Russell, who batted in the leadoff spot.North Paulding coach Jennifer Maloney said, “Every time Riley got on base she ended up scoring,” Maloney said. “She was very disciplined at the plate.”Russell, who stole 16 bases this year, also made an impact from her center field position.“Riley was a great leader in the outfield,” Maloney said.“She has explosive and quick jumps to the ball and a very good arm.”“I think I’m a good teammate and a good leader,” Russell said. “I try my best to encourage other girls and help them get up when they are down. I like to see my teammates play well too.”Russell was really happy for her teammate and fellow senior Bailey Noonan on Sept. 17, which was senior night, when Noonan hit a three-run, walk-off home run with two outs in the seventh inning to defeat Hillgrove 9-7.“It was an emotional night,” said Russell, who watched from the on-deck circle. “We were hoping to come out with the win and we did.”As a result of a 5-4 loss to North Cobb in the region tournament on Oct. 6, North Paulding will not compete in the Class playoffs and Russell will prepare for another season of softball with her Georgia Impact team.When Russell begins her tenure at Florida SouthWestern, she plans to major in elementary education because she wants to be a teacher. Russell has a 3.85 grade-point average and her favorite subject is history.Russell also considered playing softball at Polk State College and Lenoir-Rhyne University.“Playing in college will be a different level of softball,” Russell said. “It’s a whole new experience. You get to meet a bunch of different girls and learn a bunch of different things.” Russell doesn’t have a favorite softball player but said she enjoys watching the Women’s College World Series on television.
